地上平安世人蒙恩。

title.en: Angels, from the Realms of Glory

1: Angels from the realms of glory,
Wing your flight o'er all the earth;
Ye who sang creation's story
Now proclaim Messiah's birth:
2: (Refrain)
Come and worship, come and worship,
Worship Christ, the newborn King.
3: Shepherds, in the field abiding,
Watching o'er your flocks by night,
God with man is now residing;
Yonder shines the infant Light:
4: Sages, leave your contemplations,
Brighter visions beam afar;
Seek the great Desire of nations;
Ye have seen His natal star:
5: Watching long in hope and fear;

1: 荣耀天军展翅飞腾，
遨游大地看世人；
当年欢唱创造全能，
今天报告主降生：
2: 牧人夜间巡游旷野，
轮流看守众羊群；
圣婴降生光华普照，
神人同居何欢欣！
3: 博士放弃学术钻研，
仰望大星光灿烂；
万邦渴望今已得见，
获此大星福无边。
4: 圣徒屈膝台前崇敬，
祷告等候心专诚；
忽然我主显其慈容，
满殿照耀主光荣。
chorus: 齐来崇拜！齐来崇拜！
崇拜基督新生王！

authors: Latin hymn, trans. by Frederick Oakeley

1: O come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant,
Come ye, O come ye, to Bethlehem;
Come and behold Him, born the King of angels:
2: (Refrain)
O come, let us adore Him,
O come, let us adore Him,
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.
3: Sing, choirs of angels, sing in exultation,
Sing, all ye bright hosts of heav'n above;
Glory to God, all glory in the highest:
4: Yea, Lord, we greet Thee, born this happy morning,
Jesus, to Thee be all glory giv'n;
Word of the Father, now in flesh appearing:

1: 齐来宗主信徒快乐又欢欣，
齐来一齐来，大家上伯利恒；
来朝见圣婴，天使王已降生。
2: 天使结成乐队欢然同歌唱，
光明众天军，来高声同赞扬；
至高的处所，荣耀归于君王。
3: 救主生於今晨我众来欢迎；
天人诸荣耀，完全归主一身；
大哉父本像，藉圣子来显明。
chorus: 齐来虔诚同崇拜，
齐来虔诚同崇拜，
齐来虔诚同崇拜，主基督。

1: Thou didst leave Thy throne, And Thy kingly crown
When Thou camest to earth for me;
But in Bethlehem's home, Was there found no room
For Thy holy nativity.
2: Heaven's arches rang, When the angels sang,
Proclaiming Thy royal degree;
But of lowly birth, Didst Thou come to earth,
And in great humility.
3: The foxes found rest, And the birds their nest
In the shade of the forest tree;
But Thy couch was the sod, O Thou Son of God,
In the deserts of Galilee.
4: Thou camest, O Lord, With the living word
That should set Thy people free;
But with mocking scorn, And with crown of thorn,
They bore Thee to Calvary.
5: When the heavens shall ring, And the angels sing
Let Thy voice call me home, Saying, "Yet there is room -
There is room at My side for thee."
chorus: O come to my heart, Lord Jesus -
There is room in my heart for Thee!
grand chorus: My heart shall rejoice, Lord Jesus,
When Thou comest and callest for me!

1: 袮曾离宝座和君王冠冕
当袮为我来到世间；
但在伯利恒家找不到一房
容纳袮圣洁的诞生。
2: 天堂拱桥响当天使歌唱，
宣扬袮王室尊贵；
但出生卑贱袮来到世间，
带着伟大的谦卑。
3: 狐狸有歇，鸟儿有窝
住在森林树中阴影；
但袮床是草地虽为神之子
在加利利的沙漠里。
4: 主阿，袮到来带生命之道
本应释放袮子民；
但以嗤笑态和荆棘冠冕
人带袮到髑髅地。
5: 当诸天都响起而天使歌颂
愿袮声召我回，说着，「还有空房 －
chorus: 请进入我心，主耶稣 －
我心中已为袮备房！

title.en: Christians, Awake, Salute the Happy Morn

1: Christians, awake, salute the happy morn,
Whereon the Saviour of mankind was born;
Rise to adore the mystery of love
Which hosts of angels chanted from above;
With them the joyful tidings first begun
Of God incarnate and the Virgin's Son.
2: Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
Who heard th'angelic herald's voice: "Behold,
I bring good tidings of a Saviour's birth
To you and all the nations upon earth;
This day hath God fulfilled His promised word,
This day is born a Saviour, Christ the Lord."
3: He spake: and straightway the celestial choir
In hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire;
The praises of redeeming love they sang,
And heav'n's whole orb with hallelujahs rang;
God's highest glory was their anthem still,
Peace on the earth and unto men good will.

1: 基督徒，醒，向那喜晨敬礼，
因当天人类的救主诞生；
应当奋起崇拜爱的奥秘，
天军天使在天所歌颂地；
大喜的信息先从他们来，
述神成人形和处女之子。
2: 然后这事报给看守牧人，
他们听见天使宣告，「看阿，
我带着救主诞生的佳音
是关乎你和世上万国的：
今日神已实现祂的承诺，
今日诞生了救主，主基督。」
3: 他说了而天使歌团即刻
以从未听闻的欢喜圣歌，
他们合奏歌赞救赎之爱，
而全球天上响哈利路亚；
他们仍歌颂神至高荣耀，
在地上平安，喜悦归于人。

title.en: Hark! What Joyful Notes are Swelling

1: (Chous)
Glory in the highest heaven! Peace on earth, goodwill to man,
Let all praise to God be given, For Redemption's glorious plan.
2: When our days on earth are ended, And we rise to worlds above,
Then our songs shall all be blended, In one song of pard'ning love!
Then we'll tell the wondrous story, And our blessed Lord adore!
In our home of bliss and glory, We shall sing forevermore!
chorus: Glory in the highest heaven! Sound aloud the joyful strain,
Glory to the Lamb be given, Who for sinners once was slain.

1: 当我们在世日子尽，而我们升上天外，
我们的歌颂将融合，成饶恕之爱的歌！
我们将述奇妙故事，崇拜我们至亲主！
在我们福与荣耀家，我们将永远歌唱！
chorus: 至高天上显出荣耀，大响欢喜的音乐，
荣耀归于神的羔羊，祂为罪人受一死。

title.en: Who is He in Yonder Stall?

1: Who is He in yonder stall,
At whose feet the shepherds fall?
2: (Refrain)
'Tis the Lord, O wondrous story!
'Tis the Lord, the King of glory!
At His feet we humbly fall,
Crown Him! crown Him, Lord of all.
3: Who is He that stands and weeps
At the grave where Laz'rus sleeps?
4: Lo! at midnight, who is He
Prays in dark Gethsemane?
5: Who is He in Calv'ry's throes,
Asks for blessings on His foes?
6: Who is He that from the grave
Comes to heal and help and save?
7: Who is He that from yon throne
Rules the world of light along?

1: 马槽里的人是谁，
牧人俯伏祂脚前？
2: 是谁站着和哭泣
在拉撒路坟墓前？
3: 是谁在午夜时候
在客西马尼祷告？
4: 是谁临死髑髅地
为祂仇敌求恩赐？
chorus: 正是主，奇妙的故事！
正是主，荣耀的君王；
我们谦伏祂脚前，
冠祂，冠祂万物主。

title.en: Brightest and Best of the Sons of the Morning

1: Brightest and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness and lend us thine aid;
Star of the east, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid!
2: Cold on his cradle the dewdrops are shining,
Low lies His head with the beasts of the stall;
Angels adore Him, in slumber reclining,
Maker, and Monarch, and Savior of all.
3: Say, shall we yield Him, in costly devotion,
Odors of Edom and offerings divine?
Gems of the mountain and pearls of the ocean,
Myrrh from the forest, or gold from the mine?
4: Vainly we offer each ample oblation;
Vainly with gifts would His favor secure;
Richer by far is the heart's adoration,
Dearer to God are the prayers of the poor.
5: Brightest and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness and lend us thine aid;
Star of the east, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid!

1: 最光明最佳丽的晨星众子，
照亮我们黑暗，求你借助；
东方景星，此时妆饰着天际，
引我婴孩救主躺卧之处！
2: 寒冷露珠在祂摇篮上发光，
祂与马槽牲畜低头躺卧；
天使敬爱祂，正斜倚地沉睡，
创造者，君王，众人的救主。
3: 我们该以何贵礼奉献给祂，
以东地的香品，神圣供物，
山上的宝石，和海里的珍珠，
森林的没药，或矿里的金？
4: 我们献足每个供物仍徒然；
枉然地以礼物赢取取祂恩；
心中的崇拜比一切更贵重，
贫穷人的祈祷对神更亲。
5: 最光明最佳丽的晨星众子，
照亮我们黑暗，求你借助；
东方景星，此时妆饰着天际，
引我婴孩救主躺卧之处！

1: Long time ago in Bethlehem,
So the Holy Scriptures say
Mary's Boy Child, Jesus Christ,
Was born on Christmas day.
2: While Shepherds watch'd their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground;
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.
3: "Fear not" said He, for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled mind,
Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind.
4: "To you in David's town this day,
Is born of David's line,
The Saviour, who is Christ, the Lord,
And this shall be the sign."
5: "The Heav'nly Babe you there shall find
And meanly wrapped in swathing bands,
6: "All glory be to God most high,
And to the earth be peace;
Goodwill henceforth from heav'n to men
chorus: Hark now, hear the angels sing,
The Saviour's born today
And you may live for evermore,
Because of Christmas Day.

1: 很久以前在伯利恒，
圣经如此记载
圣诞日马利亚生
圣婴，耶稣基督
2: 当牧人夜守着羊群，
全都坐在地上；
主的天使降下来，
而荣耀环发光。
3: 他说，「别怕」，因为恐惧
已占他们困脑，
我带大喜的信息
给你和众人类。
4: 「今天在大卫的城里，
大卫家族诞生，
救主，就是主基督，
而这就是记号。」
chorus: 听着那些天使唱
救主今日诞生
而你可以永远活着
因为有圣诞日。

1: O little town of Bethlehem, How still we see thee lie!
Above thy deep and dreamless sleep, The silent stars go by;
Yet in thy dark streets shineth, The everlasting Light -
The hopes and fears of all the years, Are met in thee tonight.
2: For Christ is born of Mary - And gathered all above,
While mortals sleep, the angels keep, Their watch of wond'ring love.
O morning stars, together, Proclaim the holy birth,
And praises sing to God the King, And peace to men on earth.
3: How silently, how silently, The wondrous gift is giv'n!
So God imparts to human hearts, The blessings of His heav'n.
No ear may hear His coming, But in this world of sin,
Where meek souls will receive Him still, The dear Christ enters in.
4: O holy Child of Bethlehem, Descend to us, we pray;
Cast out our sin, and enter in - Be born in us today.
We hear the Christmas angels, The great glad tidings tell;
O come to us, abide with us, our Lord Emmanuel!

1: 美哉小城，小伯利恒！你是何等清静！
无梦无惊，深深睡着，群星悄然进行；
在你漆黑的街衢，永远的光昭启；
万世所求，万人所望，今宵集中于你。
2: 因马利亚诞生圣婴，天上天军齐集，
世界众生，酣睡正深，天军虔敬守夜。
晨星啊，同来颂扬，同来礼拜虔诚，
同来感谢至尊上主，同祝世界和平！
3: 何等静悄，何等静悄，这奇妙礼被赠！
神此传授给人心中，祂天堂的祝福。
无耳能听祂到来，但在这罪世里，
凡谦和人肯接待祂，至亲基督进来。
4: 求伯利恒至圣婴孩，现在仍复将临，
驱除我罪！进我胸怀，今日生於我心！
我听圣诞之天使，宣告大喜信息，
求在我心永远长住，我主以马内利。

composers: English Traditional Melody, Ralph Vaughan Williams

1: O little town of Bethlehem, How still we see thee lie!
Above thy deep and dreamless sleep, The silent stars go by:
Yet in thy dark streets shineth, The everlasting Light;
The hopes and fears of all the years, Are met in thee tonight.
2: O morning stars, together, Proclaim the holy birth,
And praises sing to God the King, And peace to men on earth;
For Christ is born of Mary; And gathered all above,
While mortals sleep, the angels keep, Their watch of wond'ring love.
3: How silently, how silently, The wondrous gift is giv'n!
So God imparts to human hearts, The blessings of His heav'n.
No ear may hear His coming; But in this world of sin,
Where meek souls will receive Him, still The dear Christ enters in.
4: O holy Child of Bethlehem, Descend to us, we pray;
Cast out our sin, and enter in; Be born in us today.
We hear the Christmas angels, The great glad tidings tell;
O come to us, abide with us, our Lord Immanuel.

1: 美哉小城，小伯利恒！你是何等清静！
无梦无惊，深深睡着，群星悄然进行；
在你漆黑的街衢，永远的光昭启；
万世所求，万人所望，今宵集中于你。
2: 晨星啊，同来颂扬，同来礼拜虔诚，
同来感谢至尊上主，同祝世界和平！
因马利亚诞生圣婴，天上天军齐集，
世界众生，酣睡正深，天军虔敬守夜。
3: 何等静悄，何等静悄，这奇妙礼被赠！
神此传授给人心中，祂天堂的祝福。
无耳能听祂到来，但在这罪世里，
凡谦和人肯接待祂，至亲基督进来。
4: 求伯利恒至圣婴孩，现在仍复将临，
驱除我罪！进我胸怀，今日生於我心！
我听圣诞之天使，宣告大喜信息，
求在我心永远长住，我主以马内利。

notes: Same lyrics: stanza 2 diff: RHC171, HP073-1stanzaless

1: There is a fountain filled with blood drawn from Immanuel's veins,
And sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains:
Lose all their guilty stains, lose all their guilty stains;
And sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains.
2: The dying thief rejoiced to see that fountain in his day,
And there may I, though vile as he, wash all my sins away:
Wash all my sins away, washe all my sins away;
And there may I, though vile as he, wash all my sins away.
3: Dear dying Lamb, Thy precious blood shall never lose its pow'r,
Till all the ransomed Church of God be saved, to sin no more:
Be saved to sin no more, be saved to sin no more;
Till all the ransomed Church of God be saved, to sin no more.
4: E'er since by faith, I saw the stream Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme, and shall be till I die:
And shall be till I die, and shall be till I die;
Redeeming love has been my theme, and shall be till I die.
5: When this poor lisping, stamm'ring tongue lies silent in the grave,
Then in a nobler, sweeter song, I'll sing Thy pow'r to save:
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save, I'll sing Thy pow'r to save;
Then in a nobler, sweeter song, I'll sing Thy pow'r to save.

1: 有一血泉，血流盈满，涌自耶稣肋边；
罪人只要投身此泉，立去全人罪愆：
立去全人罪愆，立去全人罪愆；
罪人只要投身此泉，立去全人罪愆。
2: 当日一盗，临终欢欣，因见此泉效能；
我罪可憎，不比他轻，在此也都洗净：
在此也都洗净，在此也都洗净；
我罪可憎，不比他轻，在此也都洗净。
3: 被杀羔羊，袮的宝血，永不丧失能力；
被赎教会，洗得清洁，永远与罪隔离：
永远与罪隔离，永远与罪隔离；
被赎教会，洗得清洁，永远与罪隔离。
4: 藉着信心，我见此泉，从袮伤痕流出；
救赎的爱，成我诗篇，一生铭刻肺腑；
一生铭刻肺腑，一生铭刻肺腑；
救赎的爱，成我诗篇，一生铭刻肺腑。
5: 当这咬舌结巴穷口，静息在坟墓中，
然后以更高尚美曲，颂袮救赎大能：
颂袮救赎大能，颂袮救赎大能；
然后以更高尚美曲，颂袮救赎大能。

notes: Same song: 1 stanza less: EHS008, HP158

title.en: There Is A Fountain Filled With Blood

1: There is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Immanuel's veins,
And sinners, plunged beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains.
2: The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there have I, though vile as he,
Washed all my sins away.
3: Dear dying Lamb, Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power
Till all the ransomed Church of God
Be saved, to sin no more.
4: E'er since by faith, I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die.
5: Then in a nobler, sweeter song,
I'll sing Thy power to save,
When this poor lisping, stammering tongue
6: Lord, I believe Thou hast prepared,
For me a blood-bought free reward,
7: 'Tis strung and tuned for endless years,
And formed, by power divine,
To sound in God the Father's ears
No other name but Thine.

1: 有一血泉，血流盈满，
涌自耶稣肋边，
罪人只要投身此泉，
立去全人罪愆。
2: 当日一盗，临终欢欣，
因见此泉效能；
我罪可憎，不比他轻，
已在此都洗净。
3: 被杀羔羊，袮的宝血，
永不丧失能力
被赎教会，洗得清洁，
永远与罪隔离。
4: 藉着信心，我见此泉，
从袮伤痕流出，
救赎的爱，成我诗篇，
一生铭刻肺腑。
7: 串弦调音不尽岁月，
由神圣全能造，
在父神耳边高响起
惟袮名无其他。

notes: Same lyrics: with chorus: RHC173-2stanzaless, EHS008-3stanzaless, HP158-3stanzaless

1: It was his love for me, That nailed Him to the tree,
To die in agony, For all my sin;
For my own guilt and blame, The great Redeemer came;
Willing to bear the shame, Of all my sin.
2: To Calv'ry's hill one day, The Lord was led away,
None else the price could pay, For all my sin;
He on the cross was slain, Yielding his life in pain;
He felt the bitter stain, Of all my sin.
3: Was ever love so strong? Was ever crime so wrong?
When Jesus suffered long, For all my sin;
He saw my greatest need, Became my friend indeed,
Thru Him I have been freed, Of all my sin.
chorus: Oh, what a Saviour is mine!
In him God's mercies combine,
His love can never decline,
And He loves me.

1: 是祂爱我的心，将祂钉木头上，
极痛苦中而死，为我全罪；
为我罪和责备，伟大救赎者来；
愿意为我全罪，承担羞愧。
2: 一天到加略山，主被掳去那里
别无他价可赔，为我全罪；
祂在十架被杀，痛苦中舍己命
祂因为我全罪，感受苦污
3: 爱曾何等强烈？罪曾何等错觉？
当耶稣长受苦，为我全罪；
祂见我最需要，成为我的朋友，
我全部的罪孽，通祂释放。
chorus: 啊，我有何等救主！
神怜悯在祂合组，
祂的爱永不衰退，
而祂爱我。

title.en: Ride On, Ride On In Majesty

composers: Adapted from Chorale in Musikalisches Handbuch

1: Ride on, ride on in majesty!
Hark! all the tribes "Hosanna!" cry!
O Saviour meek, pursue Thy road
With palms and scattered garments strowed.
2: Ride on, ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die:
O Christ, Thy triumphs now begin
O'r captive death and conquered sin.
3: Ride on, ride on in majesty!
The angel armies of the sky
Look down with sad and wond'ring eyes
To see th'approaching sacrifice.
4: Ride on, ride on in majesty!
Thy last and fiercest strife is nigh:
The Father on His sapphire throne
Awaits His own anointed Son.
5: Ride on! ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,
Then take, O God, Thy power, and reign.

1: 荣耀君王骑驴进行！
沿途民眾，一片歌声；
温柔救主向前进行，
棕枝、衣服，满路铺陈。
2: 荣耀君王骑驴进行！
卑微模样，就义成仁；
基督得胜，从此开始，
死亡败退，罪恶戡平。
3: 荣耀君王骑驴进行！
天上眾军俯首定睛，
遥看救主去作牺牲，
满怀忧虑，无限伤心。
4: 荣耀君王骑驴进行！
末次剧烈奋斗将临；
天上宝座圣父关心，
等候神子荣归天城。

notes: Same tune: RHC023, RHC041, RHC082, RHC138

authors: Rev. W. M'K. Darwood(William McKendree Darwood)

1: On Calvary's brow ... my Saviour died, ...
'Twas there my Lord ... was crucified; ...
'Twas on the cross ... He bled for me, ...
And purchased there ... my pardon free.
2: (Refrain)
O Calvary! dark Calvary!
Where Jesus shed His blood for me (for me);
O Calvary! blest Calvary!
'Twas there my Savior died for me.
3: 'Mid rending rocks ... and darkening skies ...
My Saviour bows ... His head and dies; ...
The opening veil ... reveals the way ...
To heaven's joys ... and endless day.
4: O Jesus, Lord, ... how can it be ...
That Thou shouldst give ... Thy life for me, ...
To bear the cross ... and agony ...
In that dread hour ... on Calvary!

1: 加略山上 。。。 我救主亡， 。。。
我主在那 。。。 被钉十架； 。。。
在十架上 。。。 为我流血， 。。。
在那赎购 。。。 我的赦免。
2: 在裂石中 。。。 黑暗天空 。。。
我的救主 。。。 垂头而死； 。。。
幔子裂开 。。。 显示道路 。。。
到天堂乐 。。。 和无穷日。
3: 耶稣，主啊 。。。 怎么可能 。。。
要袮为我 。。。 付出袮命， 。。。
背负十架 。。。 和其伤痛 。。。
在加略山 。。。 可畏之时！
chorus: 加略山啊！暗加略山！
耶稣在那为我流血（为我）；
加略山啊！宝加略山！
在那我救主为我死。

authors: Isaac Watts, chorus by Ralph E. Hudson

1: Alas! and did my Savior bleed?
And did my Sov'reign die?
Would He devote that sacred head
For such a worm as I?
2: Was it for crimes that I had done
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!
3: Well might the sun in darkness hide
And shut his glories in,
When Christ, the mighty Maker, died
For man the creature's sin.
4: But drops of grief can ne'er repay
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I give myself away -
'Tis all that I can do!
chorus: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away -
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!

1: 可叹我主，圣体血流，
为我受死哀痛，
情愿舍命，赎我愆尤，
我乃卑微无用。
2: 诚哉救主，因我罪深，
被钉苦架叹息，
莫大恩典，莫大怜悯，
无穷无尽爱心。
3: 当基督，全能创造者，
为人的罪而死，
太阳暗藏，如不忍观，
将祂荣耀关闭。
4: 我虽泪下如雨一般，
主恩不能酬报，
惟将身心全献主前，
一生遵行主道。
chorus: 在十架，在十架，我先见主恩光，
罪的重担从我心皆脱落；
在圣架，我信，眼明亮，心安康，
到如今我终日常欢乐。

title.en: The Way of the Cross Leads Home

1: I must needs go home by the way of the cross,
There's no other way but this;
I shall ne'er get sight of the gates of light,
If the way of the cross I miss.
2: I must needs go on in the blood-sprinkled way,
The path that the Saviour trod,
If I ever climb to the heights sublime,
Where the soul is at home with God.
3: Then I bid farewell to the way of the world
To walk in it never more;
For the Lord says, "Come," and I seek my home
Where He waits at the open door.
chorus: The way of the cross leads home,
The way of the cross leads home;
It is sweet to know, as I onward go,
The way of the cross leads home.

1: 我必须通十架的路回天家，
此外无他路可走；
我永远不能看见光之门，
如果我错过十架路。
2: 如果我要攀登那崇高之处，
灵魂与神住的家
我须在那洒过血的路走，
此乃救主踏过的路。
3: 然后我将告别世俗的道路
永远再不踏上它；
因我主说，“来”，而我寻我家
祂在敞开的门等候。
chorus: 十架路领导回家，
十架路领导回家，
当我往前走，心甘甜因懂
十架路领导回家。

1: There was One Who was willing to die in my stead,
That a soul so unworthy might live;
And the path to the cross He was willing to tread,
All the sins of my life to forgive.
2: (Refrain)
They are nailed to the cross, They are nailed to the cross,
O how much He was willing to bear!
With what anguish and loss Jesus went to the cross!
But He carried my sins with Him there.
3: He is tender and loving and patient with me,
While He cleanses my heart of the dross;
But "there's no condemnation" - I know I am free,
For my sins are all nailed to the cross.
4: I will cling to my Savior and never depart -
I will joyfully journey each day,
With a song on my lips and a song in my heart,
That my sins have been taken away.

1: 曾经有一位愿意代替我而死，
让个不配的灵魂能活；
而祂愿意踏上往十字架的路，
并且原谅我一生的罪。
2: 当祂在洗尽我心中所有渣滓，
何等温柔慈爱有耐心；
但“如今不定罪了” － 我知已自由，
因为我的罪被钉十架。
3: 我会紧贴我救主永远不离开 －
我会每天欢喜地远航，
我嘴唇带首歌而我心中有歌，
唱着我所有罪被带走。
chorus: 它们被钉十架，它们被钉十架，
祂愿意背负的何等多！
耶稣带何等愁苦痛失到十架！
但祂背我的罪到那里。

title.en: In the Cross of Christ I Glory

1: In the cross of Christ I glory,
Tow'ring o'er the wrecks of time;
All the light of sacred story
Gathers round its head sublime.
2: When the woes of life o'ertake me,
Hopes deceive, and fears annoy,
Never shall the cross forsake me:
Lo! it glows with peace and joy.
3: When the sun of bliss is beaming
Light and love upon my way,
From the cross the radiance streaming
Adds more luster to the day.
4: Bane and blessing, pain and pleasure,
By the cross are sanctified;
Peace is there that knows no measure,
Joys that thru all time abide.

1: 基督宝架我所夸耀，
巍然永立宇宙间；
一切圣迹光华普照，
庄严灿烂亿万年。
2: 生之颠危时来侵我，
常多忧惧，多失望，
主之宝架永不弃我，
常赐喜乐，赐安康。
3: 当福乐之太阳照射
光和爱在我路上，
光芒从宝十架发出，
增添白天的光泽。
4: 灾难，荣华痛苦，欢愉，
皆因宝架成幸福，
此中平安何可言喻，
欢乐永勿能消磨。

1: King of my life, I crown Thee now -
Thine shall the glory be;
Lest I forget Thy thorn-crowned brow,
Lead me to Calvary.
2: Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid,
Tenderly mourned and wept;
Angels in robes of light arrayed
Guarded Thee whilst Thou slept.
3: Let me like Mary, thru the gloom,
Come with a gift to Thee;
Show to me now the empty tomb -
Lead me to Calvary.
4: May I be willing, Lord, to bear
Daily my cross for Thee;
Even Thy cup of grief to share -
Thou hast borne all for me.
chorus: Lest I forget Gethsemane,
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.

1: 同来加冕生命之王，
荣耀都归给你，
恐我忘记主荆棘冕，
领我到加略山。
2: 求主示我埋你坟墓，
你為我尝死味，
愿像天使身穿白衣，
看守主在坟墓。
3: 像马利亚黎明即起，
亲至墓旁献礼，
主已復活主墓已空，
领我到加略山。
4: 我真甘心我真情愿，
背十字架跟主；
我愿与主同尝苦杯，
领我到加略山。
chorus: 使我莫忘客西马尼，
使我莫忘主之痛苦，
使我莫忘主爱為我，
领我到加略山。

1: I hear the Savior say,
"Thy strength indeed is small!
Child of weakness, watch and pray,
Find in Me thine all in all."
2: Lord, now indeed I find
Thy pow'r and Thine alone,
Can change the leper's spots
And melt the heart of stone.
3: For nothing good have I
Whereby Thy grace to claim -
I'll wash my garments white
In the blood of Calv'ry's Lamb.
4: And when before the throne
I stand in Him complete,
"Jesus died my soul to save,"
My lips shall still repeat.
chorus: Jesus paid it all,
All to Him I owe;
Sin had left a crimson stain -
He washed it white as snow.

1: 我听救主说道：
“你的力量微小！
应当儆醒祈祷，
因我作你中保。”
2: 我今确实知道，
惟主赦罪权能，
可使麻疯洁净，
融化心中顽石。
3: 我无嘉言善行，
可藉此得救恩，
惟主所流宝血，
能洗一切罪痕。
4: 将来身体得赎，
荣耀站主面前，
我口仍要颂扬：
“主赐救恩完全。”
chorus: 主替我捨身，
罪债全还清；
无数罪孽污秽心，
主洗比雪白净。

1: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee;
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy wounded side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure,
Save from wrath and make me pure.
2: Could my tears forever flow,
Could my zeal no languor know,
These for sin could not atone -
Thou must save, and Thou alone:
In my hand no price I bring,
Simply to Thy cross I cling.
3: While I draw this fleeting breath,
When my eyes shall close in death,
When I rise to worlds unknown
And behold Thee on Thy throne,
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.

1: 万古磐石为我开，
容我藏身在主怀；
愿因主流水和血，
洗我一生诸罪孽，
洗我内外全清洁，
罪恶污秽尽除灭。
2: 勤劳直到临终时，
一生流泪永不止，
依旧不能赎罪过，
惟有耶稣能救我；
两手空空无代价，
靠主捨命在十架。
3: 当我呼吸余一息，
当我临终目垂闭，
当我上升到天堂，
觐见主在宝座上，
万古磐石为我开，
容我藏身在主怀。

1: "Man of Sorrows!" what a name
For the Son of God, who came
Ruined sinners to reclaim!
Hallelujah, what a Savior!
2: Bearing shame and scoffing rude,
In my place condemned He stood -
Sealed my pardon with His blood:
Hallelujah, what a Savior!
3: Guilty, vile, and helpless we,
Spotless Lamb of God was He;
Full atonement! can it be?
Hallelujah, what a Savior!
4: Lifted up was He to die,
"It is finished," was His cry;
Now in heav'n exalted high:
Hallelujah, what a Savior!
5: When He comes, our glorious King,
All His ransomed home to bring,
Then anew His song we'll sing:

1: 天父爱子由天至，
拯救罪人脱永死，
竟然称为 “忧患子，”
哈利路亚，奇妙救主！
2: 受尽羞辱与欺凌，
代替我罪受苦刑，
借宝血我罪洗清，
哈利路亚，奇妙救主！
3: 我满罪污坏心肠，
祂是圣洁神羔羊，
我的罪债祂代偿，
哈利路亚，奇妙救主！
4: 被钉十架舍生命，
最后宣告 “事已成，”
今在高天荣美城，
哈利路亚，奇妙救主！

authors: v1 W. G. Ovens, v2-5 Gladys Westcott Roberts

1: Wounded for me, wounded for me,
There on the cross He was wounded for me;
Gone my transgressions, and now I am free,
All because Jesus was wounded for me.
2: Dying for me, dying for me,
There on the cross He was dying for me;
Now in His death my redemption I see,
All because Jesus was dying for me.
3: Risen for me, risen for me,
Up from the grave He has risen for me;
Now evermore from death's sting I am free,
All because Jesus has risen for me.
4: Living for me, living for me,
Up in the skies He is living for me;
Daily He's pleading and praying for me,
All because Jesus is living for me.
5: Coming for me, coming for me,
One day to earth He is coming for me;
Then with what joy His dear face I shall see,
O how I praise Him - He's coming for me!

1: 为我受伤，为我受伤，
在十字架耶稣为我受伤，
罪蒙赦免我今得着释放，
都因救主耶稣为我受伤。
2: 为我受死，为我受死，
在十字架耶稣为我受死，
因祂受死我得救赎福气，
都因救主耶稣为我受死。
3: 为我复活，为我复活，
由坟墓里主已为我复活；
死亡毒钩今后不能害我，
都因救主耶稣为我复活。
4: 为我活着，为我活着，
在高天上耶稣为我活着，
救主昼夜祷告祈求为我，
都因救主耶稣为我活着。
5: 必有一天主要为我再来，
见主爱脸何等喜乐畅快，
满心赞美主 － 祂为我再来！

title.en: It Is A Thing Most Wonderful

1: It is a thing most wonderful,
Almost too wonderful to be,
That God's own Son should come from heav'n
And die to save a child like me.
2: And yet I know that it is true:
He came to this poor world below,
And wept and toiled and mourned and died,
Only because He loved us so.
3: I cannot tell how He could love
A child so weak and full of sin;
His love must be most wonderful,
If He could die my love to win.
4: I sometimes think about His cross,
And shut my eyes, and try to see
The cruel nails, and crown of thorns,
And Jesus crucified for me.
5: But even could I see Him die,
I could but see a little part
Of that great love, which, like a fire,
Is always burning in His heart.
6: It is most wonderful to know
His love for me so free and sure;
My love for Him so faint and poor.
7: And yet I want to love Thee, Lord:
O light the flame within my heart,
And I will love Thee more and more
Until I see Thee as Thou art!

1: 这是件最奇妙的事，
奇妙直到难以置信，
神独生子从天而降
为救我这孩子而死。
2: 然而我知道这属实：
祂来到这可怜世界，
哭泣，劳力，悲哀，死去，
这都是因为祂爱我。
3: 难说出为何祂能爱
一个软弱满罪之子；
祂的爱一定甚奇妙，
因祂为赢我爱而死。
4: 我有时思念祂十架，
闭上眼睛而试着看
残酷钉子，荆棘冠冕，
见耶稣为我钉十架。
7: 然而我真要爱袮，主：
请点燃我心中火焰，
而我必更加地爱袮
直到我见到袮真面！

composers: Hans Leo Hassler, harmony by Johann Sebastian Bach

authors: Bernard of Clairvaux, trans. into German by Paul Gerhardt, trans. from German by James W. Alexander

1: O sacred Head, now wounded, With grief and shame weighed down,
Now scornfully surrounded, With thorns Thy only crown,
How art Thou pale with anguish, With sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish, Which once was bright as morn!
2: What Thou, my Lord, hast suffered, Was all for sinners' gain:
Mine, mine was the transgression, But Thine the deadly pain.
Lo, here I fall, my Savior! 'Tis I deserve Thy place;
Look on me with Thy favor, Vouchsafe to me Thy grace.
3: What language shall I borrow, To thank Thee, dearest Friend,
For this Thy dying sorrow, Thy pity without end?
O make me Thine forever! And, should I fainting be,
Lord, let me never, never, Outlive my love to Thee!

1: 至圣之主受重创，希世痛苦难当，
遍压荆冠皆耻辱，讥评，嫌怨，忧伤，
仰瞻慈容何惨淡？想见满怀凄怆！
此刻愁云掩圣范，当年基督辉光。
2: 我主袮受尽苦楚，罪人得蒙恩典，
袮受创痛至死亡，是因我的罪愆；
思念苦刑我当受，俯伏我主脚边；
恳求继续赐恩典，愿常瞻仰圣颜。
3: 我用何词作谢颂，如斯恩宜丰隆，
成仁临难之悲哀，无量慈怜恩宠，
恳求收我为弟子，忠爱永不变更！
千万千万莫容我离开主爱偷生。

composers: Oliver M. Cooke, arr. by Alfred B. Smith

authors: v1 Oliver M. Cooke, v2-4 Cora Brockhuizen

1: I know a fount where sins are wash'd away (away),
I know a place where night is turned to day (to day);
Burdens are lifted, blind eyes made to see;
There's a wonder working pow'r,
In the blood of Calvary.
2: I know a Saviour, He's a faithful friend (a friend),
One who is with me, will be to the end (the end).
He now in glory intercedes for me,
'Twas His precious cleansing blood,
3: I have a peace, this world could never give (not give),
Wonderful peace, for now in Christ I live (I live).
From condemnation He hath made me free,
What a wonder working pow'r,
In the blood of Calvary.
4: I have a hope, My Lord will surely come (will come),
All His redeemed ones shall be gathered home (be home).
With him in glory evermore to be,
Then we'll praise Him for the blood,
That was shed on Calvary

1: 我知个泉能将罪都洗去（洗去），
我知个处那夜晚变白昼（白昼）；
重担皆脱落，盲眼得看见；
有个奇妙运作能，
在加略山宝血里。
2: 我知个救主，祂是忠心友（朋友），
一直陪着我，一定陪到底（到底）。
祂今在荣耀在为我说情，
是祂那净化宝血，
曾经流在加略山。
3: 我有平安，是世界无法给（不给），
奇妙平安，因我在基督活（我活）。
从被定罪里祂释放了我，
何等奇妙运作能，
在加略山宝血里。
4: 我有希望，我主一定会来（会来），
祂所救赎的将召集回家。
与祂在荣耀永远都同在
我们将赞祂宝血，
当时流在加略山。

1: It was alone the Saviour prayed
In dark Gethsemane;
Alone He drained the bitter cup
And suffered there for me.
2: It was alone the Saviour stood
In Pilate's judgment hall;
Alone the crown of thorns He wore,
Forsaken thus by all.
3: Alone upon the cross He hung
That others He might save;
Forsaken then by God and man,
Alone, His life He gave.
chorus: Alone, (It was alone,), alone, (yes, all alone,)
He bore it all alone; (yes, all alone;)
He gave Himself to save His own,
He suffered, bled and died alone, alone.

1: 独自一人救主祷告
客西马尼暗中；
独自祂喝尽那苦杯
在那为我受罪。
2: 独自一人救主站立
彼拉多审判厅
独自带上荆棘冠冕，
被众世人离弃。
3: 十字架上祂独自挂
为了救赎他人
当时被神与人离弃，
独自，舍弃生命。
chorus: 独自，（独自一人，）孤单，（完全孤单，）
祂全部独自扛；（独自孤单；）
祂舍己为救祂选民，
祂受苦，流血独自死，独自。

composers: Henry Barraclough, arr. by Donald P. Hustad

title.en: There Is a Green Hill Far Away
Alas! and Did My Saviour Bleed?

1: O Love divine! what hast Thou done?
Th'immortal God hath died for me!
The Father's co-eternal Son
Bore all my sins upon the tree;
Th'immortal God for me hath died!
My Lord, my Love, is crucified.
2: Behold Him, all ye that pass by,
The bleeding Prince of life and peace!
Come, sinners, see your Maker die,
And say, was ever grief like His?
Come, feel with me His blood applied:
My Lord, my Love, is crucified:
3: Is crucified for me and you,
To bring us rebels back to God:
Believe, believe the record true,
Ye all are bought with Jesus' blood.
Pardon for all flows from His side:
My Lord, my Love, is crucified.
4: Then let us sit beneath His cross,
And gladly catch the healing stream,
All things for Him account but loss,
And give up all our hearts to Him:
Of nothing think or speak beside:
My Lord, my Love, is crucified.

1: 神圣至爱！袮做何事？
永生之神竟为我死！
与天父永存的圣子
背我全罪挂木头上；
永生之神竟为我死！
我主，至爱，被钉十架。
2: 凡是过路的，应看祂，
血流的永生和平君！
罪人来看，你创造者亡,
敢问，谁悲哀相比祂？
同我感受祂的宝血：
我主，至爱，被钉十架。
3: 为我为你被钉十架，
为带叛逆人回神旁：
相信，相信见证属真，
耶稣宝血救赎你们，
祂肋旁流众人的赦免:
我主，至爱，被钉十架。
4: 让我们坐祂十架下，
乐意领受医治之河，
为祂万事当作有损，
将我们的心全交给祂；
勿想勿谈其他事，仅此：
我主，至爱，被钉十架。

authors: Theodulph of Orleans, trans. by John M. Neale

title.en: Here, O My Lord, I See Thee Face to Face

composers: Giovanni P. Da Palestrina, adapted by William H. Monk

authors: Latin hymn, trans. by Francis Pott
Edmond L. Budry, trans. by R. Birch Hoyle

1: Golden harps are sounding, angels voices ring,
Pearly gates are opened, opened for the King:
Christ, the King of glory, Jesus, King of love,
Is gone up in triumph, to His throne above.
2: (Refrain)
All His work is ended, joyfully we sing;
Jesus hath ascended - glory to our King!
3: He who came to save us, He who bled and died,
Now is crowned with glory at His Father's side:
Nevermore to suffer, nevermore to die,
Jesus, King of glory, is gone up on high.
4: Praying for His children in that blessed place,
Calling them to glory, sending them His grace;
His bright home preparing, faithful ones, for you;
Jesus ever liveth, ever loveth, too.

1: 金竖琴正响起，天使歌声鸣，
珍珠门已打开，为王而敞开：
基督，荣耀之王，耶稣，仁爱王，
已带胜利升天，回宝座在天。
2: 祂为救我而来，流宝血而死，
今戴荣耀冠冕，回到天父旁：
永远不再受苦，永远不再死，
耶稣，荣耀之王，已升上高天。
3: 祂在有福之地，为子女祈祷，
召他们进荣耀，将恩典送上：
祂为忠心的你，准备光明家；
耶稣永远活着，也永远爱深。
chorus: 祂的工已完成，我们欢喜唱；
耶稣已经升天，荣耀归于王！

authors: John of Damascus, trans. by John M. Neale
William J. Gaither, v2-3 by Tow

title.en: Come, Ye Faithful, Raise the Strain

composers: Robert Williams, harmony by John Roberts

authors: John of Damascus, trans. by John M. Neale

title.en: Christ the Lord is Risen Today

authors: Venantius Fortunatus, trans. by John Ellerton

title.en: I Know That My Redeemer Lives
I Know That My Redeemer Liveth

composers: James M. Fillmore, arr. by Jon Drevits

title.en: See the Con-q'ror Mounts in Triumph

notes: Same tune: different tune from RHC370

1: Oft-times the day seems long, our trials hard to bear,
We're tempted to complain, to murmur and despair;
But Christ will soon appear to catch His Bride away,
All tears forever over in God's eternal day.
2: Sometimes the sky looks dark with not a ray of light,
We're tossed and driven on, no human help in sight;
But there is one in heav'n who knows our deepest care,
Let Jesus solve your problem - just go to Him in pray'r.
3: Life's day will soon be o'er, all storms forever past,
We'll cross the great divide to glory safe at last;
We'll share the joys of heav'n - a harp, a home, a crown,
The tempter will be banished, we'll lay our burden down.
chorus: It will be worth it all when we see Jesus,
Life's trials will seem so small when we see Christ;
One glimpse of His dear face all sorrow will erase,
So bravely run the race till we see Christ.

1: 日子常似漫长，试炼痛苦难当，
我们心中抱怨，发怨言并绝望；
但基督将显现，来接祂新妇走
一切眼泪都擦乾，在神永恒里面。
2: 有时天空黑暗，毫无一线曙光，
我们翻腾摇晃，无人前来帮忙；
但天上有一位，知我心深忧虑，
让耶稣解你问题，只需向祂祈祷。
3: 人生日子将尽，一切风暴永去，
我将过大分界，得荣耀永安全；
我们分享天乐，一琴，一家，一冠，
诱惑者将被驱逐，我们卸下重担。
chorus: 一切都会值得，当我见耶稣，
当我见基督时，试炼渺小；
一瞥祂的荣面，一切忧愁消灭
应当勇往直前，直见基督。

title.en: For God So Loved the World
Spirit of God, Descend upon My Heart

composers: German melody, arr. by Samuel Dyer

title.en: Breathe on Me, Breath of God

composers: Louis M. Gottschalk, arr. by Edwin P. Parker
W. S. Marshall, adapted by James M. Kirk
Ada Rose Gibbs, arr. by Norman Johnson

title.en: Open My Eyes, That I May See

composers: Maori melody, arr. by Norman Johnson

authors: John Sung Choruses, trans. by Tow

title.en: Thy Word Is Like a Garden, Lord
The Old Book and the Old Faith
Break Thou the Bread of Life
Thy Word Have I Hid in My Heart

authors: From Psalm 119, adapted by Ernest O. Sellers

1: Thy Word is a lamp to my feet,
A light to my path alway,
To guide and to save me from sin
And show me the heav'nly way.
2: Forever, O Lord, is Thy Word
Established and fixed on high;
Thy faithfulness unto all men
Abideth forever nigh.
3: At morning, at noon, and at night
I ever will give Thee praise;
For Thou art my portion, O Lord,
And shall be through all my days!
4: Thru Him whom Thy Word hath foretold,
The Savior and Morning Star,
Salvation and peace have been brought
To those who have strayed afar.
chorus: Thy Word have I hid in my heart,
That I might not sin against Thee;
That I might not sin, that I might not sin,
Thy Word have I hid in my heart.

1: 祢话是我脚前的灯，
我路上一直的光，
从罪恶引导救赎我，
并现我天堂之路。
2: 主，祢话语，永远存在，
安定稳住在高上；
祢对待众人的信实，
永远相近的长存。
3: 在早晨上午和晚上，
我会一直赞美祢；
因为祢是我的福分，
我有生之日都是！
4: 通祢话语预言的祂，
惟一救主与晨星，
救恩与平安已带来，
给流离迷失的人。
chorus: 祢话我已藏在心里，
免得我会得罪祢；
免得我得罪，免得我得罪，
祢话我已藏在心里。

1: The Bible stands like a rock undaunted
'Mid the raging storms of time;
Its pages burn with the truth eternal,
And they glow with a light sublime.
2: The Bible stands like a mountain tow'ring
Far above the works of men;
Its truth by none ever was refuted,
And destroy it they never can.
3: The Bible stands and it will forever,
When the world has passed away;
By inspiration it has been given -
All its precepts I will obey.
4: The Bible stands ev'ry test we give it
For its Author is divine;
By grace alone I expect to live it
And to prove and to make it mine.
chorus: The Bible stands tho the hills may tumble,
It will firmly stand when the earth shall crumble;
I will plant my feet on its firm foundation,
For the Bible stands.

1: 圣经屹立像无惧的大石，
在岁月狂风之中；
每页有永恒真理在燃烧，
焕发崇高的光芒。
2: 圣经屹立像个高耸大山，
高过世俗人作为；
它真实从来没人能否定，
而人们也不能毁灭。
3: 圣经屹立而永远会如此，
即使世界已废去；
它是神默示的宝贵话语，
而我会遵从它戒命。
4: 圣经屹立无论任何考验，
因它作者就神圣；
独靠恩典我期望活着它，
并要证实与拥有它。
chorus: 圣经屹立虽小山会倒塌，
它会稳住站当地球在崩溃；
我会将双脚立在它稳基础，
因圣经屹立。

composers: "Ave Hierarchia", arr. by William H. Monk

title.en: Blest Be the Tie That Binds
Glorious Things of Thee Are Spoken
I Am Coming to the Cross
Just as I Am, Without One Plea
Let Jesus Come into Your Heart
Souls of Men, Why Will Ye Scatter
Have You Any Room for Jesus?
Look to the Lamb of God
He Is Able to Deliver Thee
There Is Power in the Blood

authors: Erdmann Neumeister, trans. by Emma F. Bevan

notes: Beginning of chorus usually sung with bass clef.

title.en: Are You Washed in the Blood?

authors: Nicolaus L. von Zinzendorf, trans. by John Wesley
v1,3 Philip Doddridge, v2,4,5 Augustus M. Toplady

title.en: The Light of the Word Is Jesus
Tell Me the Old, Old Story
I Heard the Voice of Jesus Say
My Faith Has Found a Resting Place

composers: Jack P. Scholfield, arr. by Norman Johnson

title.en: I Am Trusting Thee, Lord Jesus

composers: American melody, from Carrell & Clayton's Virginia Harmony, arr. by Norman Johnson

1: Once I was bound by sin's galling fetters;
Chained like a slave, I struggled in vain.
But I received a glorious freedom
When Jesus broke my fetters in twain.
2: Freedom from all the carnal affections,
Freedom from envy, hatred and strife;
Freedom from vain and worldly ambitions;
Freedom from all that saddened my life.
3: Freedom from pride and all sinful follies,
Freedom from love and glitter of gold;
Freedom from evil, temper, and anger -
Glorious freedom, rapture untold!
chorus: Glorious freedom! Wonderful freedom!
No more in chains of sin I repine!
Jesus, the glorious mighty Redeemer!
Now and forever Jesus is mine.

1: 我曾被罪恶锁链之捆梆；
像奴不自由，徒劳挣扎。
当耶稣断开我一切锁链
荣耀之救恩，使我释放。
2: 主使我脱离情慾和嗜好；
脱离我嫉妒，恨恶狂傲；
脱离我世俗虚空之幻想；
亦使我离去一切忧劳。
3: 主使我脱离骄傲和愚昧；
脱离我溺爱，金钱迷惑；
脱离我恼怒，暴躁之性情 -
荣耀之释放，无穷喜悦！
chorus: 荣耀的释放！奇妙的释放！
我再无罪恶束缚痛苦！
荣耀释放者是救主耶稣！
从今到永远耶稣属我。

title.en: We Bless the Name of Christ, the Lord

composers: Thomas Hastings, arr. by John W. Peterson

title.en: O Love That Wilt Not Let Me Go

composers: American melody, arr. by John W. Peterson

title.en: It Is Well with My Soul
'Tis So Sweet to Trust in Jesus
A Shelter in the Time of Storm
All Things Work Out for Good

composers: Thomas Hastings, arr. by John W. Peterson
American melody, from Caldwell's Union Harmony

title.en: How Firm a Foundation, Ye Saints

composers: George D. Moore, arr. by Don Peterman

title.en: Sweet Peace, the Gift of God's Love

composers: L. M. B., arr. by Alfred B. Smith

authors: M. D., ed. by A. B. S.

1: When you feel weakest, dangers surround;
Subtle temptations, troubles abound;
Nothing seems hopeful, nothing seems glad,
All is despairing, oftentimes sad.
2: If all were easy, if all were bright,
Where would the cross be? and where the fight?
But in the testings God gives to you,
Chances for proving what He can do.
3: God is your wisdom; God is your might;
God's ever near you guiding you right;
He understands you, knows all you need:
Trusting in Him you'll surely succeed.
4: Let us press on then; never despair;
Live above feeling, victory's there;
Jesus can keep us so near to Him,
That nevermore shall our faith grow dim.
chorus: Keep on believing, Jesus is near,
Keep on believing, there's nothing to fear;
Keep on believing, this is the way,
Faith in the night as well as the day.

1: 当你最弱时，危机围绕；
微妙的试探，困苦丰多；
无事见有望，无事见喜，
全都似绝望，多时忧愁。
2: 如一切容易，如全光明，
十架该何处？争战何方？
但在神给你的试验中，
存机会证明祂全能做。
3: 神是你智慧；是你力量；
神与你甚近引导着你；
祂深了解你，知你所需：
相信着祂你必定成功。
4: 让我们前进；不要绝望；
活在感觉上，胜利在那；
耶稣能保我与祂甚近，
而我们信将永不失光。
chorus: 坚持地相信，耶稣甚近，
坚持地相信，无事可惊惧；
坚持地相信，这是方道，
在深夜有信，如同白昼。

1: Fear not, little flock, from the cross to the throne,
From death into life He went for His own;
All power in earth, all power above,
Is given to Him for the flock of His love.
2: (Refrain)
Only believe, only believe;
All things are possible, only believe;
Only believe, only believe;
All things are possible, only believe.
3: Fear not, little flock, He goeth ahead,
Your Shepherd selecteth the path you must tread;
The waters of Marah He'll sweeten for thee -
He drank all the bitter in Gethsemane.
4: Fear not, little flock, whatever your lot;
He enters all rooms, "the doors being shut,"
He never forsakes; He never is gone -
So count on His presence in darkness and dawn.

1: 别怕，小羊群，从十架到宝座，
出死进入生，祂为祂羊走；
全地上权柄，全天上权柄，
都赐给祂为了祂爱的羊群。
2: 别怕，小羊群，祂走在前头，
你牧者选择你该走的道路；
玛拉的苦水祂为你变甜 －
在客西马尼祂饮了所有苦。
3: 别怕，小羊群，无论命如何；
祂进所有房，虽「门都关了。」
祂永不丢弃，祂不会离开 －
无论黑暗黎明能指望祂在。
chorus: 只要相信，只要相信；
一切事都可能，只要相信；
只要相信，只要相信；
一切事都可能，只要相信。

title.en: Show Me Thy Way, O Lord

authors: Anonymous, revised by A. B. S.

1: Show me Thy way, O Lord, And make it plain:
I would obey Thy word, Speak yet again.
I would not take one step until I know
Which way it is that you want me to go.
2: O Lord, I cannot see; Grant me Thy light;
Darkness bewilders me, Clouding my sight;
Hold Thou my hand, and keep close by my side:
I dare not go alone; be Thou my guide.
3: I cannot see Thy face, Yet Thou are here;
When will the morning chase, My doubt and fear?
When shall I see the place where day and night
Shall come not, for Thy glory is its light?
4: I will be patient, Lord, And do Thy will;
I will not doubt Thy word, My hopes fulfil.
How can I perish, if in Thee I die;
Jesus, my Comforter, my Hope and Guide!

1: 主，显我祢道路，使它平坦：
我会遵从你话，请祢再讲。
我不会擅自地走出一步
直到我知晓祢安排何路。
2: 主，我今看不见，赐我祢光；
黑暗扰乱着我，使我目盲；
紧握着我的手，守在我旁：
我不敢独自行，请引导我。
3: 我见不到祢面，但祢仍在；
黎明何时会来，赶走迷惑？
我何时才能看到那地方
无昼夜因祢荣耀是它光。
4: 主，我会耐心等，行祢旨意；
我不怀疑祢话，我的希望。
我怎能会灭亡如在祢藏；
耶稣，我的安慰，希望，引导！

title.en: When I Fear My Faith Will Fail

1: When I fear my faith will fail, Christ can hold me fast!
When the tempter would prevail, He can hold me fast!
2: (Refrain)
He will hold me fast, He will hold me fast;
For my Saviour loves me so, He will hold me fast.
3: I could never keep my hold, He must hold me fast!
For my love is often cold, He must hold me fast!
4: I am precious in His sight, He will hold me fast!
Those He saves are His delight, He will hold me fast!
5: He'll not let my soul be lost, Christ will hold me fast;
Bought by Him at such a cost, He will hold me fast!

1: 当我怕我信心失败，基督会保我!
当诱惑者要战胜我，耶稣能保我!
2: 我自己一定站不稳，祂要抱紧我!
因我爱常常会冷淡，祂要抱紧我!
3: 在祂眼里我是宝贵，祂会抱紧我!
祂所拯救祂必喜悦，祂会抱紧我!
4: 祂不让我灵魂迷失，基督会保我!
祂以重价救赎了我，祂会抱紧我!
chorus: 祂会抱紧我，祂会抱紧我；
因我救主爱惜我，祂必抱紧我！

authors: Psalm 23, ScottishPsalter, based on Francis Rous, Sir William Mure and others

composers: Melody by Francois H. Barthelemon, arr. by Robert Simpson
Jessie Seymour Irvine, harmony by T. C. L. Pritchard

authors: Katharina von Schlegel, trans. by Jane L. Borthwick

title.en: Under the Care of My God, The Almighty

authors: From Psalm 91, United Presbyterian Bible Songs Hymnal

1: Under the care of my God, the Almighty,
Safe in the secret place of the Most High!
He is my Refuge, the Lord is my Fortress,
Him I am trusting when trouble is nigh.
2: (Refrain)
Under his wings, under his wings,
Safe in the refuge hide thee;
Trusting his truth and faithfulness,
No evil can betide thee.
3: Be not afraid for the terror of midnight,
Nor for the arrow that hasteth to slay;
Fear not the pestilence walking in darkness,
Nor the destroyer that wasteth by day.
4: Seek the Most High for thy sure habitation,
Unto Jehovah for refuge now fly;
There shall no evil befall thee nor harm thee,
Unto thy dwelling no plague shall come nigh.
5: Love thou the Lord, surely he will deliver;
He will exalt thee and answer thy prayer;
He will be with thee to honor and give thee
Life without end, his salvation to share.

1: 在我全能之真神的眷顾下，
安全住在至高者隐秘处！
祂是我避难所，主是我山寨，
急难临近时祂是我倚靠。
2: 你不必怕着那黑夜的惊骇，
或是白日飞的追杀之箭；
也不必怕那黑夜行的瘟疫，
或是午间灭人的毒病者。
3: 寻找至高者当你稳定居所，
立即飞到耶和华避难所；
祸患必不临近你或来害你，
灾害也不挨近你的帐棚。
4: 专心爱主，祂必定会搭救你，
祂会抬举你应允你祈祷；
祂会使你尊贵并且赐给你
无穷生命，分享祂的救恩。
chorus: 祂翅膀下，祂翅膀下，
安藏你在避难所；
信祂诚实和祂信实，
祸患必不临到你。

title.en: Why Worry When You Can Pray

composers: John W. Peterson and A. B. Smith
Source unknown, arr. by Alfred B. Smith

1: Speak, Lord, in the stillness
While I wait on Thee;
Hush'd my heart to listen,
In expectancy.
2: Speak, O blessed Master,
In this quiet hour;
Let me see Thy face, Lord,
Feel Thy touch of pow'r.
3: For the words Thou speakest,
They are life indeed;
Living Bread from heaven,
Now my spirit feed!
4: All to Thee is yielded -
I am not my own!
Blissful, glad surrender -
I am Thine alone!

1: 主，宁静中请说，
当我等候袮；
我心正在宁听，
盼望与等待。
2: 当颂主人，请说，
在此宁静时；
主，让我见袮面，
感触祢全能。
3: 祢所说的话语，
的确是生命；
天降的生命粮，
来喂满我灵！
4: 一切屈服于祢，
我不属自己！
开心愿意服从，
我仅属于祢！

Sitting at the Feet of Jesus
Make Me a Channel of Blessing
May the Mind of Christ, My Savior

title.en: O for a Closer Walk with God

title.en: Teach Me Thy Way, O Lord

composers: Robert Lowry, arr. by Jon Drevits

title.en: Must Jesus Bear the Cross Alone?

1: Deeper, deeper in the love of Jesus
Daily let me go;
Higher, higher in the school of wisdom,
More of grace to know.
2: Deeper, deeper! blessed Holy Spirit,
Take me deeper still,
Till my life is wholly lost in Jesus,
And His perfect will.
3: Deeper, deeper! tho' it cost hard trials,
Deeper let me go!
Rooted in the holy love of Jesus,
Let my fruitful grow.
4: Deeper, higher, ev'ry day in Jesus,
Till all conflict past,
Finds me conqu'ror, and in His own image
Perfected at last.
chorus: O deeper yet, I pray,
And higher ev'ry day,
And wiser, blessed Lord,
In Thy precious, holy Word.

1: 进深，进深，进入耶稣大爱，
每日更进深；
登高，登高，在主智慧学校
经历主恩深。
2: 进深，进深！藉着全能圣灵，
不断的进深；
直到生命消失在基督里，
溶于祂旨意。
3: 进深，进深！虽经艰难试炼，
还向标竿行；
根深蒂固在耶稣的爱里，
让我结多果。
4: 进深，登高，每日活在主里，
直到争战过；
靠主得胜，长成基督形象，
最终得完全。
chorus: 求主助我进深！
我愿登峰造极！
使我悟性更新，
在袮宝贵圣语里。

composers: George Jackson, arr. by Alfred B. Smith

1: Only to be what He wants me to be,
Ev'ry moment of ev'ry day;
Yielded completely to Jesus alone,
Ev'ry step of this pilgrim way:
2: Trusting my Saviour whatever betide,
Ev'ry moment of ev'ry day;
Knowing He's able and ready to guide,
Ev'ry step of this pilgrim way:
3: Living for Jesus, surrendered and true,
Ev'ry moment of ev'ry day;
Walking with only His pleasure in view,
Ev'ry step of this pilgrim way:
chorus: Just to be clay in the Potter's hands,
Ready to do what His Word commands;
Only to be what He wants me to be,
Ev'ry moment of ev'ry day.

1: 只愿作祂要我成为的人，
每一天的每一时刻；
完全屈服于耶稣惟属祂，
客族道路的每一步：
2: 任何事发生都信我救主，
每一天的每一时刻；
我知祂有能并乐意引导，
客族道路的每一步：
3: 为耶稣活着，屈服与忠实，
每一天的每一时刻；
行走时只以祂喜悦为观，
客族道路的每一步：
chorus: 就像窑匠手中的泥麽，
准备行祂话语的命令；
只愿作祂要我成为的人，
每一天的每一时刻。

composers: Horatio R. Palmer, arr. by Norman Johnson

title.en: Let the Lower Lights Be Burning
Have I Done My Best for Jesus?

1: I wonder, have I done my best for Jesus,
who died upon the cruel tree?
To think of His great sacrifice at Calv'ry!
I know my Lord expects the best from me.
2: The hours that I have wasted are so many,
The hours I've spent for Christ so few,
Because of all my lack of love for Jesus,
I wonder if His heart is breaking too.
3: I wonder, have I cared enough for others,
Or have I let them die alone?
I might have helped a wand'rer to the Savior,
The seed of precious Life I might have sown.
4: No longer will I stay within the valley -
I'll climb to mountain heights above;
The world is dying now for want of someone
To tell them of the Savior's matchless love.
chorus: How many are the lost that I have lifted?
How many are the chained I've helped to free?
I wonder, have I done my best for Jesus,
When He has done so much for me?

1: 我自问，是否有为耶稣尽力，
祂为我在十架而死
回想祂在加略山伟大牺牲！
我知我主要求我做最好。
2: 我浪费掉的时刻实在太多，
给基督的时间太少；
只因为我对耶稣的爱缺乏，
不知祂心是否也在破碎。
3: 我自问，是否足够关怀他人，
还是让他们孤独死？
我可以帮助浪子回到救主，
或耕下宝贵永生的种子。
4: 我不会再逗留在幽谷之内，
我将爬上高山云彩，
这灭亡的世界正等待我们，
告诉他们救主无比之爱。
chorus: 我到底扶助几位迷失的人？
我帮忙释放捆锁有几个？
我自问，是否有为耶稣尽力，
当祂为我做那么多？

title.en: Who Is on the Lord's Side

Is Your All on the Altar?

title.en: Take the World, but Give Me Jesus

title.en: I Have Decided to Follow Jesus

composers: Folk melody from India, arr. by Norman Johnson

authors: Attributed to an Indian prince, as sung in Garo, Assam

title.en: We Have Not Known Thee as We Ought

1: We have not known Thee as we ought,
Nor learned Thy wisdom, grace and pow'r;
The things of earth have filled our thought,
And trifles of the passing hour.
Lord, give us light Thy truth to see,
And make us wise in knowing Thee.
2: We have not feared Thee as we ought,
Nor bowed beneath Thine awful eye;
Nor guarded deed, and word, and thought,
Remembering that God was nigh.
Lord, give us faith to know Thee near,
And grant the grace of holy fear.
3: We have not loved Thee as we ought,
Nor cared that we are loved by Thee;
Thy presence we have coldly sought,
And feebly longed Thy face to see.
Lord, give a pure and loving heart
To feel and know the love Thou art.
4: We have not served Thee as we ought,
Alas! the duties left undone,
The work with little fervor wrought,
The battles lost, or scarcely won!
Lord, give the zeal, and give the might,
For Thee to toil, for Thee to fight.
5: When shall we know Thee as we ought,
And fear, and love, and serve aright?
When shall we, out of trial brought,
Be perfect in the land of light?
Lord, may we day by day prepare
To see Thy face, and serve Thee there.

1: 我们没应当认识袮，
没学袮智慧，恩，与能；
地上的事充满我心，
及短暂片刻的琐事。
主，赐我光见袮真理，
并赐智慧来认识袮。
2: 我们没应当畏惧袮，
没在袮威眼下俯拜，
没谨守行为，言，与思，
要记得神当时近在。
主，赐我信知袮靠近，
赐我圣洁敬虔之恩。
3: 我们没应当爱着袮，
没顾虑到袮爱我们；
我们以冷心肠寻袮，
力不从心盼见袮面。
主，赐个纯洁的爱心，
深感拥有爱源为袮。
4: 我们没应当事奉袮，
悲伤因责任做一半，
以微小热忱做袮工，
战争失败，或赢不足！
主，赐热心，并给力量，
为袮辛劳，为袮战斗。

title.en: Jesus, I My Cross Have Taken

The Son of God Goes Forth to War

Go Ye into All the World

title.en: Speak Just a Word for Jesus

title.en: Work, for the Night Is Coming

1: O give us homes built firm upon the Savior,
Where Christ is Head and Counsellor and Guide;
Where ev'ry child is taught His love and favor
And gives his heart to Christ the crucified:
How sweet to know that tho his footsteps waver
His faithful Lord is walking by his side!
2: O give us homes with godly fathers, mothers,
Who always place their hope and trust in Him;
Whose tender patience turmoil never bothers,
Whose calm and courage trouble cannot dim;
A home where each finds joy in serving others,
And love still shines, tho days be dark and grim.
3: O give us homes where Christ is Lord and Master,
The Bible read, the precious hymns still sung;
Where pray'r comes first in peace or is disaster,
And praise is natural speech to ev'ry tongue;
Where mountains move before a faith that's vaster,
And Christ sufficient is for old and young.
4: O Lord, our God, our homes are Thine forever!
We trust to Thee their problems, toil, and care;
Their bonds of love no enemy can sever
If Thou art always Lord and Master there:
Be Thou the center of our least endeavor -
Be Thou our Guest, our hearts and homes to share.

1: 请给我们建立在救主的家，
基督为首及策士和引导；
每个小孩受育知祂的慈爱，
并将幼心给钉十架基督：
当他脚步摇晃仍甜美可知
他忠信的主仍与他同行。
2: 请给我们有信主父母的家，
父母希望及信心基于祂；
当动乱时温柔耐心不摇晃，
在困境中平静勇气不息；
家中每个成员都乐意事奉，
日子再暗淡爱心仍闪耀。
3: 请给我们基督为主宰的家，
家中有读圣经和唱诗歌；
无论和平或灾难时先祷告，
而赞美对每口舌已自然；
拥有可移动山的浩大之信，
拥有基督对老少都足够。
4: 我们主神，我们家永远属袮！
一切问题，劳苦，担忧寄袮；
爱心的联合无敌人可切断
如袮是家中之首与主人：
我们最小事功愿袮为中心 －
愿袮做客，分享我心与家。

title.en: Happy the Home When God Is There

title.en: Ride On, Ride On, O Savior King

notes: Same lyrics: 2 stanzas less: RHC307, EHS088, HP140

title.en: Is Not This the Land of Beulah?

1: Lord dismiss us with Thy blessing, May Thy peace our ways attend!
Send us forth to do Thy bidding, Leading men to Christ our Friend.
May we never, may we never, Stray from Thy almighty hand!
2: Be Our Guide in days of travelling, Keep our feet from harm and sin;
Sanctify our thoughts and living, Cleanse our hearts, make pure within.
May our witness, may our witness, Draw all men to Thee our King!
3: May Thy blessed Holy Spirit, Lead us in Thy ways of truth;
May we rest in Jesus' merit, Daily all His mercies prove.
May our footsteps, may our footsteps, Never from Thy paths remove!
4: O revive us, O revive us! Daily fill our hearts with fire;
Holy Spirit come dwell in us, Cleanse, O cleanse from filth and mire.
O renew us, O renew us, Ever more our hearts inspire!

1: 主以袮祝福差遣我们，愿袮的平安随步行！
打发我们行袮的旨意，带人认识朋友基督。
愿我们永远，绝对不会，远离袮全能手安排！
2: 在人生旅途为我们引路，保守我们免祸与罪
洁净我们思绪和生活，洗净心灵变成纯白。
愿我们见证，为人举止，引导众人知袮，君王！
3: 愿袮可称颂的圣灵，领我们走在真道里
让我们靠着耶稣之义，天天证实祂的怜悯。
愿我们在世上的脚步，永远不离开袮真道！
4: 恳求袮来复兴我们，天天让我们心火热
恳求袮圣灵居住我们，洗净我们一身污秽。
恳求袮更新，更新我们，不断启发我们的心！

1: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all, be with you all;
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all, Amen.
原主耶稣的恩惠，常与众圣徒同在，同在；
原主耶稣的恩惠，与圣徒同在，阿们。
The Lord bless you and keep you;
The Lord lift His countenance upon you,
and give you peace, and give you peace;
The Lord make His face to shine upon you,
And be gracious unto you, be gracious,
The Lord be gracious, gracious unto you.
Amen.
原主赐福看顾你，
原主向你仰脸赐福与你；
赐你平安，赐你平安，
原耶和华使祂脸光照你，
赐恩与你，保护你，保护你；
原主保护你，赐恩福与你。
阿们。
Amen, Amen.
阿们，阿们。
Amen, Amen, Amen.
阿们，阿们，阿们。
Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen,
Amen, Amen, Amen.
阿们，阿们，阿们，阿们，
阿们，阿们，阿们。
May the grace of Christ our Savior,
And the Father's boundless love,
With the Holy Spirit's favor,
Rest upon us from above.
2: Thus may we abide in union,
With each other and the Lord,
And possess, in sweet communion,
Joys which earth cannot afford.
3: Amen.

1: 但愿救主基督恩惠，
天父无穷大慈爱，
圣灵感动，教训，安慰，
常与我众人同在。
2: 愿我们能同心共处，
爱戴彼此与救主，
在甜蜜团契中拥有，
世上无法供之乐。
3: 阿们。
